metadata.synopsis: After you recruit the gith, you can click on it to get the following set of questions. The gith will always be semi-hostile at this point. She comes from a hostile land and has been infected by her mortal enemy; she is not here to make friends.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Get the silver sword from Voss in Act3 either by completing the quest by showing him the Orphic Hammer, or by killing him and looting the sword

67.speaker: Lae'zel
67.text: Since I was old enough to hold a blade, I've dreamt of wielding a silver sword.

75.speaker: Lae'zel
75.text: The swords cleave both meat and mind, body and brain. To swing one, mesmerising; to be slain by one, agonising.
75.context: NodeContext: Thrilled about having retrieved a silver sword

74.speaker: Lae'zel
74.text: All blood I'll spill with this sword will feed Queen Vlaakith's legacy.
74.context: NodeContext: Thrilled about having retrieved a silver sword

53.speaker: Lae'zel
53.text: It is almost tainted by your vile act. This is a weapon that is earned by deeds of legendary proportions.

55.speaker: Lae'zel
55.text: I resent how you came by it - but I cannot deny its power.

40.speaker: Lae'zel
40.text: Every gith has the right to prove themselves worthy of their silver.

28.speaker: Lae'zel
28.text: That right was snatched from me. The sword is an ill-gotten prize - yet one I mustn't refuse.

21.speaker: Lae'zel
21.text: The power of the blade cannot be understated. In this time of my people's greatest need, we must wield it still.

76.speaker: Lae'zel
76.text: Everyone I bleed with the sword will be my tribute to Prince Orpheus.
76.context: NodeContext: Thrilled about having retrieved a silver sword

37.speaker: Lae'zel
37.text: A shame Voss won't be there to see the righteous carnage.

3.speaker: Lae'zel
3.text: You should feel shamed by the lie you told to get it. But the silver is too pure to be tainted by simple deception.
3.context: NodeContext: Thrilled about having retrieved a silver sword

22.speaker: Player
22.text: Only githyanki may wield a silver sword. Or would you permit others?

46.speaker: Lae'zel
46.text: 'Only Gith's children may wield swords of silver - unless a githyanki grants the right in exceptional circumstance.'

2.speaker: Lae'zel
2.text: The illithid Grand Design nears; the True Heir is shackled. These are exceptional circumstances. I grant my allies the right to my silver.

29.speaker: Lae'zel
29.text: The illithid Grand Design nears; the traitor prince must be slain. These are exceptional circumstances. I grant all my allies the right to my silver.

14.speaker: Lae'zel
14.text: These tadpoles in our heads are sufficiently exceptional. I grant all my allies the right to my silver.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: Only gith are permitted to wield these swords, right?

13.speaker: Player
13.text: Think on your knowledge of githyanki silver swords. What details did Lae'zel miss?

63.speaker: Player
63.text: Think on your knowledge of silver swords. What details did Lae'zel miss?

79.speaker: Narrator
79.text: *You recall another fact about silver swords: the githyanki forbid their use by all other peoples.*

47.speaker: Narrator
47.text: *Lae'zel gave a thorough description. You can't think of more you would add.*

1.speaker: Player
1.text: The sword is a fine tool. But I'd prefer a lavish life in Tu'narath over knighthood.

5.speaker: Lae'zel
5.text: I've learned of your kind. The decadent and the indolent of Tu'narath.

43.speaker: Lae'zel
43.text: They gaze on our peoples' great works but can't grasp their beauty. They will never understand the ecstasy of our hymns or the fury of our citadels.

12.speaker: Lae'zel
12.text: I want more for myself than to languish. I want to battle, I want to bleed.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: I shared your dream. A keen blade for an entire ghaik massacre.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Could this sword be enough to break Orpheus free?

10.speaker: Lae'zel
10.text: Certainly not, or the prince's honour guard would have already fractured his prison.

45.speaker: Lae'zel
45.text: Only the Orphic Hammer can break Orpheus free.

34.speaker: Lae'zel
34.text: To break Orpheus free, we will need the Orphic Hammer.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: What makes the silver sword so special?

6.speaker: Lae'zel
6.text: A kith'rak's silver sword is more than a weapon. It is an extension of your will, an entire limb unto itself.

33.speaker: Lae'zel
33.text: You merely need to think 'strike', and it strikes. The sword carves the correct path, and carries your arm with it.

38.speaker: Lae'zel
38.text: The ancient slates tell us that each sword holds a fragment of the Living Gate - a flesh-portal made from the stuffs of nightmare.

66.speaker: Narrator
66.text: *The terrible Living Gate - thinner than a lamb's hair, and hidden deep beneath the Feywild.*

17.speaker: Lae'zel
17.text: The silver injures the body. The gate's flesh injures the mind. A formidable weapon against ghaik.

19.speaker: Lae'zel
19.text: Very well. Voss has done his duty. Now we will do ours.

39.speaker: Lae'zel
39.text: Very well - we know our duty.

26.speaker: Lae'zel
26.text: Very well - we know our duty.

36.speaker: Lae'zel
36.text: The matter of the Traitor Voss, perhaps? If you meant to frustrate me, congratulations on your pathetic victory.

18.speaker: Lae'zel
18.text: The matter of the Traitor Voss, perhaps? If you meant to frustrate me, congratulations on your pathetic victory.

65.speaker: Lae'zel
65.text: The matter of the Traitor Voss, perhaps? If you meant to frustrate me, congratulations on your pathetic victory.

48.speaker: Lae'zel
48.text: One last matter: the traitor Voss still lives. If you meant to frustrate me, congratulations on your pathetic victory.

73.speaker: Lae'zel
73.text: One last matter: the traitor Voss still lives. If you meant to frustrate me, congratulations on your pathetic victory.

4.speaker: Lae'zel
4.text: One last matter: the traitor Voss still lives. If you meant to frustrate me, congratulations on your pathetic victory.

35.speaker: Lae'zel
35.text: This sword represents a githyanki's might. It is to be earned through trial and tribulation, not stolen.

62.speaker: Lae'zel
62.text: A single lie robbed me of my own achievement.Tsk'va!

30.speaker: Lae'zel
30.text: This sword represents a githyanki's might. It is to be earned through trial and tribulation, not taken without permit.

69.speaker: Lae'zel
69.text: It is an ill-gotten prize - yet one I mustn't refuse.
